page.title: 07WILDLIFE AND COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: Badgers and Foxes are common, and fallow Deer are sometimes seen in Guiting Wood. Butterflies do well and those seen include Marbled White, Brimstone, Small Copper and Peacock. There is a rich variety of plant life. The natural woodland where it has been left undisturbed is Beech. Guiting Wood is rich in Bluebells, and also has wild aquilegia and Herb Paris. Other plants found include Wild Thyme and Rock Roses. Orchids also thrive, there are several speices to be found including early Purple Orchids, Butterfly Orchids and Pyrmidal Orchids. The natural Beech woodland is however in process of being replaced by Coniferous Fir and Larch which are planted for profit.
